title: Synthetic Recap
body:
CHICAGO — On a night where offense was a premium and defense reigned supreme, Michael Jordan authored a performance so dominant it defied the very nature of the game. In a brutal 100-73 victory over the Milwaukee Bucks, Jordan didn’t just lead the Chicago Bulls; he *was* the Chicago Bulls, pouring in a staggering 42 points in a contest where no other player on either team managed more than 13.

The final score suggests a team-wide rout, but the story was a one-man masterpiece. In a grinding, physical battle where baskets were earned through sheer force of will, Jordan was an unstoppable force. He attacked from every angle, his 42 points a beacon of offensive brilliance in a sea of defensive struggle. While the rest of the Bulls combined for 58 points, His Airness provided the engine, the fuel, and the fire.

Milwaukee, led by Ray Allen’s 13 points, simply had no answer. They were witnesses to history, powerless against a singular force of nature. With Scottie Pippen contributing 12 points and Dennis Rodman cleaning the glass with 19 rebounds, the Bulls’ supporting cast provided the necessary defensive grit, allowing Jordan the freedom to execute his artistic assault.

In the end, the stat sheet tells a tale of two games: one a collective defensive effort, the other a historic, singular explosion. On a night remembered for its final score, the true, indelible story was the number 42 next to Jordan’s name—a monumental effort that underscored, once again, his unparalleled greatness.
